title: Defending Muhammad’s marriage to a child should be socially unacceptable in the Muslim apologetics community

author: ComparativeReligion
text:
There are some Hadith informing Aisha (ra) was a teen (15/19) when she got married to the Prophet (pbuh).

However, even if you dismiss them it still doesn’t matter. A 9 y/o in the 7^th C was not like a 9 y/o today. Putting modern livelihoods and ages on 7^th C Arabia is unfair and dishonest at best.

There is a whole science behind Hadith studies. One should really read into it before making a post.

author: mattofspades
text:
Yikes. I love that your argument is “the hadiths say she was actually an older teen, but even if she was actually 9, it’s unfair to consider that wrong based on 7th C Arabia”

Embarrassing to read back rephrased, right?  Also…

>	There is a whole science behind Hadith studies

No, boss.  That’s not “science” just because you use the word. It can certainly qualify as “studies,” but it’s about as important as someone who studies lord of the rings lore.

Most Muslims I’ve seen here like to specifically divorce hadiths from the Quran, because it kinda delegitimizes it in a real way with regards to the religion being overall “peaceful”. The Hadith’s are where the religion becomes truly wicked and evil, like with apostasy. If anything, they’re a stain on an otherwise fairly decent religious text. Better than the Bible, at least.

You really want to lean on them to support an argument about a weird “prophet” screwing a child?  That’s pretty fun.
